p.s: Teacher: How would you say "I can't go to the party because I have to study"?
Student: Ich kann nicht zur Party gehen, da ich lernen muss.
Teacher: Excellent!
Teacher: How would you say "They can't play outside because it's raining"?
Student: Sie können nicht draußen spielen, da es regnet.
Teacher: Well done!
Teacher: How would you say "She can't come to the meeting because she is sick"?
Student: Sie kann nicht zum Treffen kommen, da sie krank ist.
Teacher: Perfect!
Teacher: How would you say "He can't buy the book because he doesn't have enough money"?
Student: Er kann das Buch nicht kaufen, da er nicht genug Geld hat.
Teacher: Great job!
Teacher: How would you say "We can't go on vacation because we don't have time"?
Student: Wir können nicht in den Urlaub fahren, da wir keine Zeit haben.
Teacher: Excellent!
Teacher: How would you say "They can't watch a movie because the cinema is closed"?
Student: Sie können keinen Film anschauen, da das Kino geschlossen ist.
Teacher: Well done!
Teacher: How would you say "We can't go to the park because it's too cold"?
Student: Wir können nicht in den Park gehen, da es zu kalt ist.
Teacher: Great job!
Teacher: How would you say "He can't play soccer because he is injured"?
Student: Er kann kein Fußball spielen, da er verletzt ist.
Teacher: Excellent!
Teacher: Great job with the additional examples using "da." Keep practicing and you'll become even more comfortable using it. Well done!
